channel.title: Bug on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Bug on PR

item.title: How to open/view/share embedded documents in Microsoft Word for Mac (2011/2016)
item.description: You would be surprised to know that Microsoft doesn’t support a viable option to view embedded documents. Embedded PDF’s are the worst, even the .

item.title: Failed to get brightness for displayID
item.description: If you are experiencing frequent disk I/O and your console is full of 25/08/12 4:30:19.506 PM ALSPlugin 235.55[62]: Failed to get brightness for displayID 0x042731c0

item.title: BTServer CPU Usage
item.description: I recently uninstalled all previous versions of xcode (I had all xcode from ios 3.2.x) to install 4.2 on my MBP.

item.title: My new photo (screenshot sharing) blog
item.description: A colleague told me that I should be a QA Engineer in a random conversation few months ago. Though I did not consider it but he stands by it even now.

item.title: PeerGuardian and history.db
item.description: PeerGuardian is a great tool to maintain your privacy. But you should be aware of a fact that it uses a sqlite db to maintain the history called history.

item.title: [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile '579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB' can't be found
item.description: Check dependencies Code Sign error: Provisioning profile [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile ‘579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB’ can’t be found Anyone who is relatively new to iPhone development could easily identify this issue is related to the invalid provisioning profile.

item.title: Why AppStore submission process sucks!
item.description: They only check the binary to see if they use any private API nothing other than that. Sometimes they reject the app and give you a reason that it doesn’t fit with their HIG standards.

item.title: Nobody is using NOSCRIPT tag?
item.description: It seems nobody is using NOSCRIPT tag. I never used in my application as well. But it is surprising that even Google itself ignoring the NOSCRIPT.

item.title: Weird issue with application icons on iPhone dashboard
item.description: Note: Apple reported this as fixed in version 3.1 and above. The screenshot above was taken with an iPhone OS 3.
